original: Bomgren, Erik Gunnar, advokat, Göteborg, f. 4/9/02 i Nora av tandläk. Carl Erik B. o. Elsa Fernholm. G. 30 m. Ruth Westberg. Barn: Elsa-Britta f. 31. — Stud:ex. i Västerås 20, jur. kand. i Upps. 23. E. o. not. i Göta hovr. 24, tingstjg. i Askims, Västra o. Östra Hisings samt Säve-dals hds doms. 26-28, anst. å G. Fit-gers Adv:byrå i Gbg 28-35, numera deläg. i Dr Philip Lemans adv :byrå, bitr. lär. i rättsvetensk. v. Gbgs hand:-högsk. 34 o. 35, tf. spec :lär. v. HHS 38-42. Led. av Sv:es adv:samf. sed. 30, advisamf. sekr. 35-42, led. av ’Styr. sed. 46. Utg. av samt red:sekr. f. Tidskr. f. Sv:es adv:samf. 35-42. Skr.: ett antal avhandl. o. upps. i denna m. fl. fackpubl.
translated: Bomgren, Erik Gunnar, lawyer, Gothenburg, born September 4, 1902 in Nora to dentist Carl Erik B. and Elsa Fernholm. Married to Ruth Westberg since 1930, with a daughter named Elsa-Britta born in 1931. He graduated from high school in Västerås in 1920 and obtained a law degree from Uppsala University in 1923. He served as a clerk in the Göta Court of Appeal in 1924, and as a magistrate in Askims, Västra and Östra Hisings, as well as Säve-dals district court from 1926 to 1928. From 1928 to 1935, he worked for G. Figgers law firm in Gothenburg and is now a co-owner of Dr. Philip Leman's law firm. He was also an adjunct professor of legal science at Gothenburg's College of Commerce in 1934 and 1935 and a temporary special lecturer at Gothenburg University from 1938 to 1942. He has been a member of the Swedish Bar Association since 1930, serving as secretary of the advisory committee from 1935 to 1942 and a member of the board since 1946. He edited and served as secretary for the Journal of the Swedish Bar Association from 1935 to 1942. He has written several articles and papers for this and other publications as well.

memberOf.name: Journal of the Swedish Bar Association
